subject: Re: Park Trek DNS - Onboarding
preview: Thank you for sending this through. Disregard my earlier email re host details. Charles

full_threads.body:
Thank you for sending this through.
Disregard my earlier email re host details.
Charles
(Closing will reopen when new reply comes)

Hi Charles,

That is great news regarding the DNS records. I am glad to hear the authentication warnings have been resolved.

Server Details:
As requested, here are the current server details for your records and IT support:
  • Host: Kinsta
  • IP Address: 162.159.135.42
  • Access: We can invite you again via your email

Cloudflare & Bot Traffic:
We are very familiar with Cloudflare and absolutely recommend it to filter out that traffic. To specifically address the heavy bot activity coming from China, we recommend implementing two specific rules:
  1. Block Specific Countries: If you do not expect legitimate customers from China (or other specific regions), we can block access from those countries entirely.
  2. JS Challenge (image attached): We can enable a "Managed Challenge" (JS Challenge). This runs a background check to confirm the visitor is a human browser and not a bot before letting them load the site.

If you would like us to proceed with setting these up for you, just let us know!

Hi Marcelo,

We believe it has now been resolved since you updated the DNS records as we originally requested. If we have any issues we will let you know.

In the meantime can you please, as discussed, et us know the server details in case we need to access anything or need to refer our IT support to it.

Finally, as you may have noticed, we are being hit by significant BOT related traffic ex China. I believe Cloudflare is a good tool to filter out this meaningless traffic.

Are you familiar with Cloudflare and would you also recommend installing it to address this issue and ensure our data is meaningful?

Thank you,

Charles

Charles Thompson | Managing Director

Hi Bailey,

Hope you're doing well! I just wanted to follow up and check if the email authentication issue has been resolved on your end. Were you able to run any test emails from Outlook and ActiveCampaign, and are the warnings still appearing?

If you’re still seeing any issues, please feel free to forward a screenshot of the message, it’ll help us pinpoint and resolve it quickly.

Thanks so much for your patience, we really appreciate it and want to make sure everything is running smoothly. We're always happy to help!

Hi Bailey,

Thank you so much for sending through the verification code, we’ve now confirmed that ActiveCampaign is fully verified on our end.

We’ve also made updates to the DNS records to help address the warning you’ve been seeing. When you have a moment, would you mind running a quick test from both Outlook and ActiveCampaign to see if the issues still appears?

If the issue still appears, could you please take a screenshot of the email here and forward the email to us? Having the specific screenshot will help us better understand what’s happening and troubleshoot more effectively.

See the sample image below:


We really appreciate your patience and collaboration on this. Please rest assured that we’re actively monitoring and ready to take the next steps as soon as we have your test results.

action.text: Marcelo Meneses assigned to Marcelo Meneses

full_threads.body:
Hi Marcelo,

I just did a test email (4:55 Melb time) from Outlook & ActiveCampaign and both are still showing up with the same "be careful" message. It appears MailerSend has still not fixed the issue. Even if you are able to fix it within ActiveCampaign, the issue is still happening when we send directly from our Outlook.

charles@parktrek.com.au please check out Kinsta. I really thing the issue lies somewhere within there as it did last time.

Unfortunately, we do not have any users left to create one for Wolf IQ. As a result, I can provide my login details, please text me at 0419 657 805 for the 2FA code.

https://parktrek16901.activehosted.com/

bailey@parktrek.com.au

Anek!aL)#.aPWxo

Thanks!

Best,

Bailey Hoadley | General Manager

Hi Charles,

Thank you again for taking the time to speak with me earlier today. It was great to clarify things and go through the updates together.

As discussed on the call:

  • Could you please provide delegated access to your ActiveCampaign CRM using support@wolfiq.com.au? This will allow us to properly authenticate your emails and ensure that all messages are delivered without warnings. Please let us know once the access is set up so we can proceed.
  • Regarding the server details, we had sent an invitation earlier, but to make it easier, we’ll send it over again. The server is hosted in Kinsta, and you’ll be able to log in directly once the invitation comes through.

We really appreciate your help with this, Charles. Once we have the CRM access and you’ve received the server details, we can make sure everything is fully functioning smoothly on your end.

During a recent call, Charles confirmed the following:

Call Log – Park Trek

  • Email Authentication:
    • Charles confirmed test emails were sent via ActiveCampaign.
    • We requested delegated access using support@wolfiq.com.au to complete authentication.
    • Charles agreed to provide access.
  • Server Details Inquiry:
    • Charles asked for server details for verification (previously on-site server).
    • We confirmed details will be sent via email.
  • Walking Tour Page Issue:
    • We informed Charles the page is now working; earlier issues were likely caching-related.
    • Confirmed functional across multiple browsers; Charles noted discrepancy between Edge and Chrome.
  • Next Steps / Action Items:
    • Charles to provide ActiveCampaign access
    • Email them about this request. Server & CRM Access
    • Server details to be emailed to Charles.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Andy, Ava and Allie,

We are having serious problems with our website at probably the most important time of the year and with a sale.

Emails are coming out unauthenticated and I still do not know the server details so we can log in to take a look in the absence of your team resolving.

See screenshot below of error "unauthenticated" domain messages.


It's very disappointing after what looked like some good initial progress. Furthermore I discovered last night:
1. The tour pages on our home page were directing to old blog posts not the correct tour pages - I have since resolved that per my email to your team last night.
2. On google chrome the web pages are simply not laying out right (see screenshot below) - they are showing words and no images which is thoroughly unengaging. They seem to be laying out right on Edge - but I need this reviewed and resolved and confirmed asap.


Please could one of you call me to discuss as soon as possible. This is a terrible time to be sending unauthenticated emails to website enquiries and contacts via our CRM.

This is precisely why I asked about shifting from Site Ground to your Server - please reassure me your assurances were sound.

Charles

Charles Thompson | Owner & Managing Director

Hi Ava,

Bailey and I have just discovered that our emails (from Microsoft Outlook and via Active Campaign) are appearing as unauthenticated in recipients inboxes with a warning.

I think this may be due to the recent changes of server - can you please take a look and action or advise accordingly.

Clearly we do not want any recipients receiving warnings that add friction to enagamenet.

Thanks
Charles & Bailey

Thank you for confirming Charles!

Have a good weekend as well

That works well. Thank you.
Have a good weekend.

Hi Charles,

Just confirming that we’ve added the “Booking Terms & Conditions” link back into the footer under Quick Links, pointing to the PDF you shared.

Please feel free to have a quick check on your end, and let us know if you’d like any tweaks to the wording or placement.

Happy to help with anything else!

Thank you Ava that all makes sense and is useful guidance.

Just one separate thing, I noticed that the link to our Booking Terms & Conditions may have dropped off our website footer.

Ordinarily it would be under the "Quick Links" as "Booking Terms & Conditions". A PDF version of our latest version has been uploaded to the WordPress Media Library - link is: https://www.parktrek.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/2025-12-12-Updated-Booking-Terms-Conditions-Final-As-Loaded-on-Rezdy.pdf .

Are you able to add it to the footer as suggested above?

Have a great weekend.

Hi Charles,

Thanks for checking in - hopefully you saw our email update from earlier in the week that the vast majority of the SEO items identified in the audit are complete.

The team is just in the progress of working on the website speed, and finalising the schema.

Fantastic question regarding making edits moving forward. To ensure your website changes don't accidentally undo our SEO work, here are some key guidelines.

  • Please avoid changing the below without contacting us for a safe implementation plan, which usually involves setting up redirects:

    • URL Slugs: Avoid changing the web address (URL) of any existing page.

    • Deleting Pages: Avoid deleting pages, products, or blog posts.

    • Technical Tags: Avoid editing the core technical fields (H1 tags, canonical tags, noindex settings).





  • You can safely make these routine updates, as they support SEO:

    • Posting New Blogs: Ensure the title and content are unique.

    • Minor Content Edits: Tweak product descriptions or basic copy.




You have also been onboarded to our Essentials plan, which entitles you to 15mins each month of ad hoc support. If you ever want to check before making an update, feel free to email support@wolfiq.com.au and they can assist.

Thanks team,


Ava Webster

Project Manager



☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au
